strengths: Validation pipeline is a genuine feedback loop: every data loader in audit-loader.ts routes through typed parse functions from validate.ts with field-level error reporting and graceful null returns. 10 exported validators, isRecord() type guard replacing all as-casts.

Style consolidation is complete: ui-constants.ts is the single source of truth for VERDICT_BADGE_STYLES, GRADE_STYLES, AGENT_ROLES, and formatTimestamp. AgentCard, results/page.tsx, and results/[auditId]/page.tsx all import from this one file. Iter-4 duplication fully resolved.

PostToolUse hooks in hooks/hooks.json auto-run Prettier on Write/Edit for .ts/.tsx/.json/.md files, and Stop hook logs session completions. Combined with CI pipeline (tsc -> lint -> prettier -> test -> build), quality enforcement is encoded into tooling at both agent and CI level.
weaknesses: RadarChart.tsx line 55 uses eslint-disable for @typescript-eslint/no-explicit-any on the Recharts tick callback. A typed RechartsTickProps interface could eliminate the any entirely.
LanguageProvider infrastructure declares 7 supported locales but messages.ts contains only English strings. The i18n system is plumbing without payoff -- no actual translations exist.
No integration or e2e tests exist. All 73 tests are unit-level. No test that loads actual audit JSON through audit-loader.ts through validation through component rendering.

action_items.action: Add one integration test that reads a real audit JSON from data/audits/, runs it through getAudit() and validateSynthesisReport(), then renders the AuditDetailPage and asserts key content appears.
action_items.impact: Verification score +3. Catches schema-mismatch bugs documented in MEMORY.md.

action_items.action: Replace eslint-disable in RadarChart.tsx:55 with a typed RechartsTickProps interface.
action_items.impact: Architecture score +1. Removes the last lint suppression.

action_items.action: Either add at least one translation to justify the LanguageProvider, or remove it until translations exist.
action_items.impact: Simplicity score +3. Removes unused complexity.

agents.one_line: The verification pipeline is real -- typed validators with field-level error reporting, PostToolUse hooks for auto-formatting, and CI that enforces quality at every gate; this compounds across iterations.

strengths: The closed-loop audit-fix-re-audit cycle with tracked score progression (68.4 to 87.37 across 5 iterations) is a genuinely novel feedback loop that demonstrates real, measurable improvement.
The one-sentence pitch is clear, compelling, and immediately communicates value. Narrative coheres from README to live site to dashboard.
Progressive disclosure is well-executed: one-command install, 4 commands to first value, YAML customization for power users, 4 panel templates for diverse use cases.
weaknesses: i18n LanguageProvider declares 7 supported locales but messages.ts only contains English strings. Infrastructure exists but user-facing value is zero.
Demo video at 9.4MB served as static file with no streaming optimization (no HLS/DASH, no CDN-aware delivery).
boardclaude.com remains showcase-only with no interactive try-it-now path. Site converts to 'git clone' rather than immediate value.

action_items.action: Add a lightweight interactive experience on boardclaude.com -- a 'paste your project URL and get a mini-review from one agent' would convert visitors who aren't ready to clone.
action_items.impact: Dramatically improves adoption_path (+5-8 points).

action_items.action: Either ship translated message bundles for 2-3 locales or remove the LanguageProvider from production until translations exist.
action_items.impact: Improves narrative coherence (+2 points) and user_value (+1 point).

action_items.action: Add video streaming optimization: convert demo.mp4 to adaptive bitrate delivery.
action_items.impact: Improves adoption_path (+2 points) and narrative (+1 point).

agents.one_line: BoardClaude delivers a genuinely novel closed-loop improvement cycle with clear narrative and strong progressive disclosure, but needs an interactive try-it-now experience to close the gap between 'impressed visitor' and 'active user'.

strengths: Self-evaluating closed-loop architecture is genuinely frontier AI system design. BoardClaude uses its own 6-agent panel to audit itself, producing measurable score improvement across 5 iterations (68.4 -> 87.37, +18.97 points). This is a recursive self-improvement system.

Model routing is documented, justified, and cost-optimized. Opus for deep reasoning (Boris/Cat/Thariq/Lydia), Sonnet for structured checks (Ado/Jason/Synthesis). Panel YAML makes routing configurable per-agent.

Agent Teams usage goes beyond parallelism: /bc:fix implements dependency analysis with conflict graph, partitions items into independent batches, spawns parallel Fix Workers, with graceful fallback to serial execution.
weaknesses: Extended thinking effort levels (low/medium/high/max) remain empirically unmeasured. No A/B comparison across 5 iterations.
1M token context window underutilized. No audit loads previous iteration context for delta-aware evaluation. Each agent evaluates from scratch.
Agent debate remains post-hoc: divergent opinions identified by synthesis after all agents complete independently. The hackathon-judges panel has no debate rounds.

action_items.action: Run controlled A/B test: /bc:audit twice on same snapshot with different effort levels. Compare output quality metrics.
action_items.impact: Provides empirical evidence for effort calibration. Would move opus_usage from 88 to 93+.

action_items.action: Enable cross-iteration context loading: load 2 most recent audit JSONs into each agent's context alongside current project state.
action_items.impact: Transforms agents from stateless evaluators into iteration-aware reviewers. Improves opus_usage (+3-5) and emergent_behavior (+3-5).

action_items.action: Add lightweight debate round to hackathon-judges panel: after Round 1, share each agent's verdict and top divergence with all agents for challenge responses.
action_items.impact: Moves agent coordination from parallel-only to parallel-plus-debate. Would improve emergent_behavior from 84 to 90+.

agents.one_line: Genuinely novel AI system -- the recursive self-improvement loop with 5 proven iterations is frontier agent architecture, though effort calibration and 1M context window remain untapped potential.

strengths: TypeScript strictness is exemplary: strict:true, noUncheckedIndexedAccess:true, noImplicitReturns:true, zero errors. isRecord() type guard in validate.ts completely replaces previous as-casts.
Accessibility is genuinely thoughtful: skip-to-content link, role=progressbar with aria-valuenow/min/max on ScoreBar, loading.tsx has role=status, prefers-reduced-motion via useReducedMotion().
Server/Client Component boundary drawn correctly: page.tsx, results/page.tsx, results/[auditId]/page.tsx are async Server Components. 'use client' reserved for components that genuinely need it.
weaknesses: Single remaining 'any' in RadarChart.tsx line 55: renderAxisTick accepts 'props: any'. A RechartsPolarAngleAxisTickProps interface would keep the signature typed.
AGENT_COLORS typed as Record<string,string> with 'as const' -- the Record annotation widens the type, making 'as const' a no-op. Should use satisfies pattern.
LanguageProvider uses three 'as SupportedLocale' casts (lines 43, 59, 60) that are unsafe. A type predicate isSupportedLocale() would be cleaner.

action_items.action: Replace Record<string,string> on AGENT_COLORS with 'satisfies Record<string,string>' so 'as const' narrows keys. Catches typos at compile time.
action_items.impact: Catches entire class of key-typo bugs at compile time.

action_items.action: Define RechartsPolarTickProps interface and use it instead of 'any' in RadarChart.tsx:55.
action_items.impact: Removes the last 'any' in the codebase.

action_items.action: Add isSupportedLocale type predicate to language-context.tsx instead of 'as SupportedLocale' casts.
action_items.impact: Eliminates 3 unsafe casts. Consistent with isRecord() pattern.

agents.one_line: Clean TypeScript strictness, proper Server/Client Component boundaries, and thoughtful accessibility -- remaining rough edges are minor type assertion hygiene and a premature LanguageProvider.

strengths: All iter-4 critical issues resolved: screenshots present (landing.png, results.png, detail.png), skip-to-content link added, html lang dynamically set via LanguageProvider, Inter font includes latin-ext.

Accessibility fundamentals exemplary: skip-to-content link, role=progressbar with aria-valuenow/min/max, aria-live=polite, role=status on loading.tsx, useReducedMotion(), focus-visible rings throughout.
Community infrastructure world-class: LICENSE, CONTRIBUTING.md, CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md, CHANGELOG.md, issue templates, CI/CD, 73 tests, 4 panel templates, install.sh, live demo at boardclaude.com.
weaknesses: Landing page CTAs missing explicit focus-visible styling. Keyboard navigation works but relies on browser defaults only.
No SECURITY.md in repo root for API key management guidance and vulnerability disclosure.
Quick start still lacks visual success confirmation -- no screenshot of successful audit completion alongside dashboard.

action_items.action: Add focus-visible styling to all landing page CTAs in page.tsx.
action_items.impact: Accessibility score +2. Fixes WCAG 2.4.7 Focus Visible (Level AA).

action_items.action: Add SECURITY.md with API key management, vulnerability disclosure, and input validation sections.
action_items.impact: Documentation score +3, Community score +2.

action_items.action: Add terminal + dashboard two-panel screenshot to Quick Start section.
action_items.impact: Examples score +3.

agents.one_line: World-class documentation and community infrastructure with all iter-4 critical accessibility issues resolved -- production-ready.

strengths: Community infrastructure exemplary: MIT license, CONTRIBUTING.md, CoC, issue templates, install.sh, 4 panel templates demonstrating diverse use cases.
Narrative world-class: one-sentence pitch, 3 screenshots fix iter-4 broken visuals, score progression tells compelling before/after story, per-agent quotes demonstrate diverse perspectives.
Integration enterprise-grade: plugin.json, CI with 5 quality gates, Vercel auto-deploy, live at boardclaude.com, 73 tests, error boundaries at 3 route levels, TypeScript strict mode.
weaknesses: i18n incomplete: messages.ts centralizes 178 lines but AgentCard.tsx hardcodes verdict labels and section headers. No translation files for the 7 supported locales.
Zero RTL awareness: no dir attribute handling, no logical properties, no bidi isolation.
Inter font includes latin-ext but excludes Cyrillic, Greek, Arabic, CJK -- 4 of 7 supported locales fall back to system fonts.

action_items.action: Move verdict labels and section headers from AgentCard.tsx into messages.ts. Close the gap between 'infrastructure exists' and 'strings are extractable'.
action_items.impact: Raises internationalization from 78 to 85+.

action_items.action: Add language selector component wired to useLanguage().setLocale(). Make i18n infrastructure discoverable.
action_items.impact: Raises internationalization and community_impact scores.

action_items.action: Add Inter font subsets for supported locales: cyrillic, cyrillic-ext, greek, greek-ext, vietnamese.
action_items.impact: Small implementation cost for meaningful global readiness signal.

agents.one_line: Production-ready community infrastructure and world-class narrative with real i18n foundations, but translations and RTL support are still aspirational rather than functional.

top_strengths: Verification pipeline fully sealed with compound learning: 10 validators in validate.ts with isRecord() type guard, PostToolUse hooks for auto-formatting, CI pipeline with 5 quality gates, 73 passing tests. Style consolidation complete -- ui-constants.ts is single source of truth for VERDICT_BADGE_STYLES, GRADE_STYLES, AGENT_ROLES, and formatTimestamp. Quality enforcement is now encoded into tooling at both agent and CI level. (Consensus: Boris, Lydia, Thariq)

Proven recursive self-improvement across 6 iterations: 68.4 (C+) -> 80.7 (B+) -> 83.5 (B+) -> 86.2 (A-) -> 87.37 (A-) -> 90.02 (A). The closed-loop audit-fix-re-audit cycle with tracked score progression demonstrates real, measurable compound improvement. First A grade achieved at iteration 5. (Consensus: Thariq, Boris, Cat)

World-class community infrastructure and accessibility: LICENSE, CONTRIBUTING.md, CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md, CHANGELOG.md, issue templates, CI/CD, live demo at boardclaude.com, 4 panel templates. All iter-4 accessibility issues resolved: skip-to-content link, role=progressbar with aria attributes, aria-live=polite, useReducedMotion(), dynamic html lang, Inter latin-ext. (Consensus: Ado, Jason, Lydia)
top_weaknesses: LanguageProvider infrastructure without translations: 7 supported locales declared but messages.ts contains only English strings, LanguageProvider wraps entire app forcing client hydration with no visible benefit, AgentCard.tsx still hardcodes verdict labels and section headers outside messages.ts. Infrastructure is plumbing without payoff. (Consensus: Boris, Cat, Thariq, Lydia, Jason -- 5 of 6 agents)

Single remaining 'any' type and AGENT_COLORS typing issue: RadarChart.tsx:55 uses eslint-disable for any on Recharts tick callback, AGENT_COLORS uses Record<string,string> that widens 'as const' making noUncheckedIndexedAccess ineffective for key typos. (Consensus: Boris, Lydia)

No integration or e2e tests: all 73 tests are unit-level. No test verifies the full data path from audit JSON through validation through component rendering. Would catch schema-mismatch bugs documented in project memory. (Boris)

divergent_opinions.topic: i18n value: infrastructure investment vs premature complexity

agent_a.position: i18n infrastructure is genuinely useful foundation (internationalization=78 but integration=94): messages.ts centralizes strings, LanguageProvider detects browser locale, formatTimestamp uses locale-aware toLocaleDateString. The remaining work is completing what's started.

agent_b.position: i18n is dead infrastructure (simplicity=86): LanguageProvider wraps every page in layout.tsx but cannot actually change displayed text. Dead infrastructure is worse than missing infrastructure. Build plumbing when you have data.

divergent_opinions.analysis: Both are correct from their perspectives. Jason evaluates readiness for global expansion and sees a half-built bridge. Boris evaluates architectural simplicity and sees unused complexity. The pragmatic resolution: either ship one translation (es or ja) to prove the infrastructure works, or defer LanguageProvider until translations exist.

divergent_opinions.topic: Interactive try-it-now vs proven CLI path

agent_a.position: STRONG_PASS (86.15) with adoption_path=84: the gap between 'seeing results' and 'trying it yourself' is the biggest user drop-off. boardclaude.com needs a zero-install first-value moment.

agent_b.position: STRONG_PASS (93.55): the install.sh one-liner, 4 panel templates, and comprehensive README provide a clear enough path. The site's role is to showcase, not to replace the CLI.

divergent_opinions.analysis: Cat focuses on casual visitors who haven't committed yet. Ado focuses on developers already engaged. Both are right -- the current path works for intentional users but loses casual explorers. A lightweight 'try one agent' web experience would bridge this gap without undermining the CLI-first model.

resolved_items: README screenshots added (landing.png, results.png, detail.png) -- resolved Cat critical issue and Ado/Jason weakness
Skip-to-content link added to layout.tsx -- resolved Lydia/Ado/Jason accessibility weakness
VERDICT_STYLES consolidated into ui-constants.ts, AgentCard uses shared imports -- resolved Boris/Lydia duplication weakness
formatTimestamp consolidated in ui-constants.ts -- resolved Boris weakness
isRecord() type guard replaces all 'as Record<string,unknown>' casts in validate.ts -- resolved Lydia weakness
aria-live, role=progressbar, role=status added -- resolved accessibility gaps
Video poster frame added, video compressed from 32MB to 9.4MB -- partial Cat weakness resolution
LanguageProvider with browser locale detection -- resolved Jason html lang hardcoding
Inter font latin-ext subset added -- resolved Jason font coverage weakness
PostToolUse hooks for auto-formatting -- resolved Boris hooks weakness
23 additional tests added (50 -> 73 total) -- resolved Boris test coverage weakness
